header.bio: Full-stack programmer with a great interest in the web.

aboutMe.part1: I am a passionate full-stack programmer specialized in creating web interfaces and APIs. Graduated in computer science in 2021, I have gained skills in web development and creating user-friendly interfaces.
aboutMe.part2: I design and implement aesthetic and functional web pages. My web development skills enable me to contribute significantly to any web development project.
aboutMe.thanks: Thank you for visiting my portfolio!

ugram.part1: In the Advanced Web Application Development course at université Laval, we are required to develop an application in teams of 6 that is similar to Instagram. We need to develop both the front-end and back-end.
ugram.part2: The front-end is built using React and Material UI. Our back-end utilizes nodejs, Nestjs, and MongoDB. Both are written in Typescript.
ugram.part3: An important part of the project is to use AWS S3 to host the images and for continuous deployment. The project is currently under active development.

ufood.part1: In the Web Application Development course at université Laval, we had to create an application, in a team of 6, to find nearby restaurants and write reviews for them.
ufood.part2: The project was developed using Vue.js 3 and Tailwind CSS. We were evaluated based on the implemented functionalities, the cleanliness of the code, and the project architecture.

porfolio.part1: This site is completely made by myself!
porfolio.part2: I used React as well as Tailwind to break down the sections into reusable components. I made sure that the site is responsive both in desktop and mobile display.
porfolio.part3: The latest version of the website is automatically deployed using Github actions and Github pages.
porfolio.githubLink: You can view the code here:

IndustrielleAlliance.part1: During my academic career, I completed three internships in the last 2 years. The first two internships were back-end developer positions. I worked on the API (back-end for front-end) for the new React application. The API was written in C# with .Net Core and stored data in a SQL database.
IndustrielleAlliance.part2: My third internship at Industrielle Alliance was a React developer position. I participated in creating a new application for insurance sales. The project used React, Redux, Typescript, Tailwind CSS, and Storybook.
